Anarchist

Giorgos Karagiannidis

While he denies being a member of the Cells of Fire, Giorgos was tried in the so-called “Halandri case.” He was found guilty of manufacturing explosives, possessing explosives, and being an accomplice to the explosion at the home of PASOK ministers Louka Katseli and Gerasimos Arsenis. Sentenced to 20 years in prison out of a total combined sentence of 32 years.

  • Read more about Giorgos Karagiannidis
  • Add new comment

Yolanda Fernández Fernández

Yolanda is one of the Barcelona 5 arrested in 2013 and facing charges for defending anarchist ideology on social networks.  After 123 days in prison, the case was dropped due to insufficient evidence.

  • Read more about Yolanda Fernández Fernández
  • Add new comment

Xabier González Solar

Xabier is one of the Barcelona 5 arrested in 2013 and facing charges for defending anarchist ideology on social networks.  After 123 days in prison, the case was dropped due to insufficient evidence.

  • Read more about Xabier González Solar
  • Add new comment

Thomas Meyer-Falk

An update from Thomas on June 6, 2013:

After being imprisoned for almost 17 years nonstop, from the 8th of July 2013 onward I will be held in Preventative Detention (Sicherungsverwahrung, a form of “security detention” in Germany for convicts who have served full terms, but are still considered to be a risk to “public safety” and therefore detained past the end of their sentence). So I want to use this final period of my prison sentence to write a balance sheet of sorts.

  • Read more about Thomas Meyer-Falk
  • Add new comment

Theofilos Mavropoulos

Theofilos Mavropoulos was arrested after his wounding in a gunfight with cops in Pefki (Athens), on 18/05/2011. He joined CCF, while he was in prison with a public statement.

  • Read more about Theofilos Mavropoulos
  • Add new comment

Silvia Muñoz Layunta

Silvia is one of the Barcelona 5 arrested in 2013 and facing charges for defending anarchist ideology on social networks.  After 123 days in prison, the case was dropped due to insufficient evidence.

  • Read more about Silvia Muñoz Layunta
  • 1 comment
  • Add new comment

Rami Syrianos

Rami is a non-aligned anarchist who was sentenced on 28/05/12 to 8 years & 8 months for a January 2011 armed robbery in Thessaloniki expropriating money from a government auction house.  Address is correct as of: 31/08/14.

  • Read more about Rami Syrianos
  • Add new comment

Panayiotis "Takis" Masouras

Panayiotis  was arrested on September 23, 2009. He was finally granted a conditional release on March 23, 2011 (given that he had already been in prison for 18 months, which in Greece is the maximum amount of time one can serve without having been sentenced). He denies being a member of the Fire Cells Conspiracy, but was nevertheless tried in the so-called “Halandri case” (for three specific Fire Cells Conspiracy attacks) and sentenced to 11 years and 6 months in prison.

  • Read more about Panayiotis "Takis" Masouras
  • Add new comment

Panayiotis Argyrou

He was arrested on 01/11/2010 along with Gerasimos Tsakalos, while participating in one of the CCF’S campaigns, which involved the shipping of 14 parcel-bombs to various foreign embassies and leaders. They had two parcel bombs on them and another two have already been sent by them. While Tsakalos was known to police simply because he is an anarchist, Argyrou had a warrant out for his arrest since October 2009 on charges of belonging to the Fire Cells Conspiracy, and he was also awaiting trial for allegedly torching a public bus two years ago.

  • Read more about Panayiotis Argyrou
  • Add new comment

Olga Economidou

Olga Ekonomidou was arrested on 14/03/2011, in Volos, along with another 4 CCF’s members, after a night raid by police’s special forces and Anti-terrorist squads at the house the where living. In December of 2014, she was sentened to 25 years in prison in the Fire Conspiracy Cells case.

  • Read more about Olga Economidou
  • Add new comment
